item.title: I'm a Permit Holder Unable to Park My Car on Clapton Way Due to Sudden Influx of Cars Parking Throughout the Week, 7th July
item.description:
A new church has opened up closeby. They've been fully parking on my road on Sundays from 8 AM to about 10 PM. Lately, they've now been parking throughout the week from 6:30 PM to about 10 PM. It's now difficult for paying permit holders to park our cars.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Clapton Way, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Major street drainage problem, 7th July
item.description:
A main drain on Grittleton Road is currently blocked. After rain the drain is flooded with water and collects on the street. See photos attached that shows a large pool of water above the drain after yesterday’s rain.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Grittleton Road, Kensal Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gully clearing not carried out, 7th July
item.description:
Blocked gully not cleared see notice 01/10/24 which is still on lampposts. Work was not carried out or signs removed,who checks these works are actually done? So with the heavy rain last night Cemetery Lane at the junction with Park Drive was once again flooded.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Charlton Park Road, Charlton, London

item.title: Graffiti in the Road/ illegal markings, 7th July
item.description:
The Road name is Batchwood Green. The issue has been here 1 day. We are a collective of concerned residents writing to report an illegal road marking that has been painted outside a private driveway on a council-owned road. The marking was done without permission, is factually unlawful, and is causing confusion for drivers. It also negatively affects the appearance of the street. We are particularly concerned that leaving it in place may encourage others to do the same, setting a precedent that this kind of action is acceptable — when it is not. We kindly request that this is investigated and removed urgently.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 30, Batchwood Green, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 broken paving slabs outside 3 Cropley Street, 7th July

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cropley Street, Hackney, London

item.title: Water pipe burst, 7th July
item.description:
A water pipe burst and is currently being repaired by Thames Water. There appears to be no permit on the roadwork website and there is no information on the Thames Water website https://public.londonworks.gov.uk/roadworks/home The incident is right next to Maconochies Road (Stop A)
Report on FixMyStreet
